page.title: 13TRANSPORT IN TODDINGTON AREA
page.content:
{ {Transport}is a dominant factor in this area. The M1{Motorway}passes between Toddington and Harlington. There is a junction and a Service Station. The Service Station, run by Granada, provides all facilities and is the largest in Europe.
Harlington has a{Railway}Station which is used by diesel and electric trains. Inter-City trains pass at 100 m.p.h. Approx. 450 people commute to London daily. Trains stop for Flitwick, Bedford, Luton, London.
The{bus}service goes to Bedford and Luton via the villages. A private bus Company, Buffalo, takes commuters to London. Approx. 600 vehicles pass through the village in an hour. One third are commercial.
